community 0.0.1
  • Reference

Add a plot to a webpage

Source: R/output_plot.R
output_plot.Rd

Adds a Plotly plot to a webpage, based on specified or selected .

output_plot(x = NULL, y = NULL, color = NULL, color_time = NULL,
  dataview = NULL, click = NULL, subto = NULL, options = NULL)

Arguments

x

Default title at the top of the element.
y

Default message below the title, to be replaced by the information table.
color

The name of a variable, or ID of a variable selector to use to color lines.
color_time

The ID of a selector to specify which timepoint of color to use.
dataview

The ID of an input_dataview component.
click

The ID of an input to set to a clicked line's ID.
subto

A vector of output IDs to receive hover events from.
options

A list of configuration options, with named entries for any of data, layout, or options, potentially extracted from a saved plotly object (see Plotly documentation).

Value

A character vector of the content to be added.

Examples

if (FALSE) {
output_info("Initial State", "Make a selection for more information.")
}
